condoning.question: Did I encourage other Catholics to remain absent from Sacraments or Mass?
condoning.description: One of the spiritual works of mercy is to admonish the sinner and to correct them out of love and charity instead of condoning sin.

condoning.question: Did I allow other Catholics to remain absent from Sacraments or Mass without correcting them?
condoning.description: One of the spiritual works of mercy is to admonish the sinner and to correct them out of love and charity instead of condoning sin.

condoning.description: One of the spiritual works of mercy is to admonish the sinner and to correct them out of love and charity instead of condoning sin.

condoning.question: Have I allowed my desire for human validation to lead me to compromise my beliefs rather than upholding what I know is right?
condoning.description: Prioritizing human approval over standing firm in God's truth demonstrates both moral cowardice and places human opinion above divine authority.

condoning.question: Did you condone a funeral where human remains were not properly buried?
condoning.description: Failing to advocate for proper burial of human remains is considered sinful as the Church teaches that the body is sacred and deserves reverent burial, with scattering or keeping remains being contrary to the dignity of the human body and resurrection belief.

condoning.question: Did I intentionally permit those in my life to be exposed to bad influences?
condoning.description: Parents have to protect their children's well-being, guarding them from harmful elements that could damage their faith or lead them into sin.

condoning.question: Did I give my approval to another Catholic who was planning to marry outside the Church?
condoning.description: Marriage is a sacrament within the Catholic faith and thus giving approval and not admonishing the action gives scandal by condoning.

extracted_data_phrases: by remaining silent when they considered marrying someone outside the Church
condoning.question: Did I give my approval to another Catholic by remaining silent when they considered marrying someone outside the Church?
condoning.description: Marriage is a sacrament within the Catholic faith and thus giving approval and not admonishing the action gives scandal by condoning.

extracted_data_phrases: through my words to another Catholic who chose to marry outside of the Church
to another Catholic who chose to marry outside of the Church
condoning.question: Did I give tacit approval through my words to another Catholic who chose to marry outside of the Church?
condoning.description: Marriage is a sacrament within the Catholic faith and thus giving approval and not admonishing the action gives scandal by condoning.

condoning.question: Did I allow my work habits to disrupt the rest and worship that others, especially those in positions of authority, observe on Sundays?
condoning.description: It's irreverent to work on a Sunday as it's a holy day of rest, worship, and a day of protest against the servitude of work and the worship of money (CCC).

uncharity.question: Did I permit someone else to suffer injustice or be treated unfairly?
uncharity.description: This sin violates the principles of justice, charity, and our moral obligation to defend human dignity and protect our neighbors from harm when we have the ability to intervene.

uncharity.question: Have I been unwilling to lend assistance when someone genuinely needed it?

lukewarmness.description: Lukewarmness in spiritual growth is sinful because one essentially chooses comfort and mediocrity over the transformative love God offers, which Jesus specifically warned against in Revelation 3:16.

vainglory.question: Did I give alms so others would see me doing it?

extracted_data_phrases: in actual or simulated acts of intimacy
lust.question: Have I engaged in actual or simulated acts of intimacy outside of marriage?
lust.description: While our sexual nature is a gift, using it to indulge in sensual pleasures is sinful as it's ordered for a particular purpose within marriage.

autonomy.question: Did you take for granted the good things in your life, forgetting to acknowledge their source in God's providence?
autonomy.description: Believing that one's blessings are due to one's own self-sufficiency and determination is a sin as it is a rejection of recognizing Divine Providence as being ultimately responsible.

extracted_data_phrases: of my own efforts rather than God 's providence
autonomy.question: Did I take for granted the good things in my life, thinking they were a result of my own efforts rather than God's providence?
autonomy.description: Believing that one's blessings are due to one's own self-sufficiency and determination is a sin as it is a rejection of recognizing Divine Providence as being ultimately responsible.

extracted_data_phrases: as the source of my successes
autonomy.question: Have I credited God for my accomplishments, forgetting to acknowledge Him as the source of my successes?
autonomy.description: Believing that one's blessings are due to one's own self-sufficiency and determination is a sin as it is a rejection of recognizing Divine Providence as being ultimately responsible.

autonomy.question: Did I mistakenly believe that my own abilities and efforts are sufficient for success, failing to acknowledge my complete dependence on God's grace?
autonomy.description: Pride is self-reliance repeats Lucifer's original sin of wanting independence from God and fails to acknowledge our complete dependence on divine grace.

extracted_data_phrases: without seeking God 's guidance and grace
autonomy.question: Did I attempt to navigate life's challenges solely through my own abilities, without seeking God's guidance and grace?
autonomy.description: Pride is self-reliance repeats Lucifer's original sin of wanting independence from God and fails to acknowledge our complete dependence on divine grace.

autonomy.question: Did I trust solely in my own abilities, forgetting that true success is rooted in God's providence?

in situations where I should have exercised greater restraint , potentially damaging relationships and reputations

extracted_data_phrases: in eating or drinking beyond what 's reasonable
gluttony.question: Did I overindulge in eating or drinking beyond what's reasonable, giving in to cravings and neglecting my self-control?
gluttony.description: This sin of gluttony demonstrates an inordinate attachment to worldly pleasures and rejects the call to temperance.

extracted_data_phrases: in eating or drinking beyond what 's reasonable
gluttony.question: Did I overindulge in eating or drinking beyond what's reasonable, especially when participating in social events or gatherings where excesses of food and drink are commonly experienced?
gluttony.description: This sin of gluttony demonstrates an inordinate attachment to worldly pleasures and rejects the call to temperance.

extracted_data_phrases: in eating or drinking to excess

extracted_data_phrases: in wasteful financial risks that have precedence over my long - term responsibilities
prodigality.question: Have I excessively indulged in wasteful financial risks that have precedence over my long-term responsibilities?
prodigality.description: This sin violates the virtue of stewardship by recklessly risking resources God has entrusted to us, while potentially harming our ability to provide for family and those in need.

prodigality.question: Have I recklessly prioritized frivolous indulgences over my financial responsibilities, causing harm to myself and others in need?
prodigality.description: This sin violates the virtue of stewardship by recklessly risking resources God has entrusted to us, while potentially harming our ability to provide for family and those in need.

gossip.description: Gossip violates human dignity and charity by harming others' reputations for our own entertainment or pride.

impiety.question: Did I engage in work on a Sunday, a day reserved for rest and worship, without a legitimate reason?
impiety.description: It's irreverent to work on a Sunday as it's a holy day of rest, worship, and a day of protest against the servitude of work and the worship of money (CCC).

impurity.question: Did I use practices, substances, or objects to prevent pregnancy?
impurity.description: This sin intentionally separates the unitive and procreative purposes of marriage and violates the proper use of one's sexuality.

impurity.description: This sin intentionally separates the unitive and procreative purposes of marriage and violates the proper use of one's sexuality.

infidelity.question: Have I broken my marriage vows through any actions that betray trust in my current state of separation?
infidelity.description: Fidelity in marriage is viewed as a sacred covenant made before God - not just a contract between people, thus breaking vows is seen as a betrayal of both divine and human trust.

fornication.question: Did I have any non-procreative sex outside of marriage?
fornication.description: While the sexual natures are a gift, it's a sin to stray away from their ordering toward the unitive and procreative nature within marriage.

fornication.question: Did I have any non-marital sex that was not intended for procreation?
fornication.description: While the sexual natures are a gift, it's a sin to stray away from their ordering toward the unitive and procreative nature within marriage.

extracted_data_phrases: perhaps through conversations or online interactions that compromised their commitment to one another
adultery.question: Have I entertained inappropriate feelings toward someone else's spouse, perhaps through conversations or online interactions that compromised their commitment to one another?
adultery.description: This sin undermines the sacred bond of marriage by treating another person as an object of desire rather than respecting their dignity and commitment to their spouse.

extracted_data_phrases: from mediums , fortune tellers , tarot card readers , or Ouija boards
sorcery.question: Have you, through words, sought knowledge or guidance from mediums, fortune tellers, tarot card readers, or Ouija boards?
sorcery.description: This sin is a violation of the First Commandment because it attempts to bypass God's providence and divine will by seeking supernatural knowledge through forbidden means, effectively placing trust in occult practices rather than in God.

presumption.question: Have you deliberately persisted in sinful behavior, counting on God's mercy without making any effort to change your habits and attitudes that may be contributing to them?
presumption.description: Presumption of God's mercy is a sin against hope because it takes His forgiveness for granted without true repentance or effort to amend one's life, showing disrespect for divine justice and mercy.

presumption.question: Did you procrastinate going to confession while in a state of sin, showing a reckless disregard for God's mercy through the sacrament of reconciliation?
presumption.description: Deliberately delaying confession while in mortal sin is a serious offense because it recklessly endangers your soul's salvation, shows contempt for God's mercy through the sacrament of reconciliation, and demonstrates prideful presumption that you'll have time later to repent.

presumption.question: Did you put off going to confession while knowingly living in a state of sin, presuming that you would have time later to repent?
presumption.description: Deliberately delaying confession while in mortal sin is a serious offense because it recklessly endangers your soul's salvation, shows contempt for God's mercy through the sacrament of reconciliation, and demonstrates prideful presumption that you'll have time later to repent.

presumption.question: Did you deliberately delay going to confession while in a state of sin, neglecting your soul's salvation and God's mercy through the sacrament of reconciliation?
presumption.description: Deliberately delaying confession while in mortal sin is a serious offense because it recklessly endangers your soul's salvation, shows contempt for God's mercy through the sacrament of reconciliation, and demonstrates prideful presumption that you'll have time later to repent.

apostasy.description: Denying God's existence after having been baptized apostasy is one of the gravest sins possible because it is declaring the Author of Life and Source of all being to be non-existent, which directly contradicts both reason and divine revelation.
